intro: Peucedanum nudiceps, commonly known as the naked-stemmed angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems and compound leaves with finely divided lobes. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the family, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Peucedanum nudiceps is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
